## correlations centrality geography-currents


```{r}


# Function to calculate correlations for each group
calculate_correlations <- function(data) {
  cor_data <- data %>%
    select(3:9) %>%  # Select the relevant columns
    cor() %>%  # Calculate correlation matrix
    as.data.frame() %>%  # Convert to dataframe
    rownames_to_column(var = "variable1") %>%  # Convert row names to a column
    pivot_longer(cols = -variable1, names_to = "variable2", values_to = "correlation")  # Reshape to long format
  
  return(cor_data)
}

# Calculate correlations for each archipelago
correlation_results <- df_centrality_cur_geo_litt %>%
  group_by(archipelago) %>%
  nest() %>%
  mutate(correlations = map(data, calculate_correlations)) %>%
  unnest(correlations) %>%
  select(-data)  # Remove the nested data column

# View the results
correlation_results
```

```{r}
df_percent_degree_all_p <- df_centrality_cur_geo_litt |>
```

```{r}

# Create plot function with correlation annotation and trend lines
create_plot <- function(data, x_col, y_col, xlabel, ylabel, title) {
  # Calculate correlations for each archipelago
  correlations <- data %>%
    group_by(archipelago) %>%
    summarise(correlation = cor(get(x_col), get(y_col), method = "pearson"),
              .groups = "drop")
  
  # Calculate the y-axis range
  y_range <- range(data[[y_col]], na.rm = TRUE)
  
  # Define vertical positions based on the y-axis range
  vertical_positions <- y_range[1] + c(0.9, 0.8, 0.7) * diff(y_range)
  
  correlations <- correlations %>%
    mutate(vertical_position = vertical_positions[as.numeric(factor(archipelago, levels = c("Galapagos", "Canaries", "Azores")))])
  
  ggplot(data, aes_string(x = x_col, y = y_col, color = "archipelago", fill = "archipelago")) +
    geom_point(size = 6, colour = "white", pch = 21) +
    geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE, linetype = "solid") +  # Add regression lines
    scale_fill_manual(values = colors) +
    scale_color_manual(values = colors) +
    labs(title = title, x = xlabel, y = ylabel) +
    theme_classic() +
    my_theme +
    theme(legend.title = element_blank(),
          legend.position = "top") +
    # Add correlation annotations on the left side
    geom_text(data = correlations, 
              aes(x = -Inf, y = vertical_position, label = sprintf("r = %.2f", correlation), color = archipelago),
              hjust = -0.1, vjust = 0.5, size = 5)
}



# Data preparation
df_percent_degree_all_p <- df_centrality_cur_geo_litt |> 
  mutate(log_in_degree = log(in_degree),
         log_out_degree = log(out_degree))

# Plotting each centrality measure
plot_in_degree <- create_plot(df_percent_degree_all_p, 
                              x_col = "degree_geo", y_col = "log_in_degree", title = "",
                              xlabel = "Degree (geographic)", ylabel = "log(In-degree) (currents)")

plot_out_degree <- create_plot(df_percent_degree_all_p, 
                               x_col = "degree_geo", y_col = "log_out_degree", title = "",
                               xlabel = "Degree (geographic)", ylabel = "log(Out-degree) (currents)")

plot_closeness <- create_plot(df_percent_degree_all_p, 
                              x_col = "closeness_geo", y_col = "closeness", title = "",
                              xlabel = "Closeness (geographic)", ylabel = "Closeness (currents)")

plot_betweenness <- create_plot(df_percent_degree_all_p, 
                                x_col = "betweenness_geo", y_col = "betweenness", title = "",
                                xlabel = "Betweenness (geographic)", ylabel = "Betweenness (currents)")

# Display plots
ggarrange(plot_in_degree, 
          plot_out_degree, 
          plot_closeness, 
          plot_betweenness, 
          ncol = 2, 
          nrow = 2,
          common.legend = TRUE,
          legend = "top",
          labels = LETTERS[1:4])

ggsave(here::here("c_output/figures/plot_centrality_geo_currents.png"), height = 9, width = 9.3)
```
